bitfield.description: VD output mask This register masks the VD output to the IPIPE module. This can be useful when one wants to read data from SDRAM which are stored in a double buffer. If the VD is not masked each time we start the module an new VD will be generated to the IPIPEIF module. Let's consider two buffers A and B of N lines each. *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: VD output mask is disabled.
VD output mask is enabled.

bitfield.description: IPIPE I/F Enable This register is used to start the operation of SDRAM buffer memory read and generates SYNC signals. This register is available when INPSRC1 or INPSCR2 = 1, 2 or 3.

bitenum.description: IPIPE SDRAM I/F Disabled
IPIPE SDRAM I/F Enabled

bitfield.description: Selects the source for the mux (VPORT / ISIF / SDRAM) as well as the data format type.

bitenum.description: RAW data from VPORT
RAW data from SDRAM
YUV data from SDRAM
ISIF_DARKFM Dark frame subtration or WDR merge is selected. Input ports to DFS/WDR submodule are VPORT and SDRAM.

bitfield.description: SDRAM read data shift This register is available when INPSRC1 or INPSRC2 = 1 or 2, i.e., when data are read from SDRAM. If UNPACK = 1 or 2, this value must be 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4.

bitenum.description: If UNPACK=1 or 2, this value is invalid. If UNPACK=3 or (UNPACK=0 and RAW16=0) Output data[15:0] = '0000' read data[15:4] If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[9:0]) '000000'
If UNPACK 0 or RAW16=0 Output data[15:12] = '0000' Output data[11:0] = read data[10:0] '0'; If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[14:0]) '0'
If UNPACK=1 or 2, this value is invalid. If UNPACK=3 or (UNPACK=0 and RAW16=0) Output data[15:0] = '0000' read data[15:4] If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[8:0]) '0000000'
If UNPACK 0, or RAW16_SDRAM=0 Output data[15:12] = '0000' Output data[11:0] = read data[11:0] If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = read data[15:0]
If UNPACK 0 or RAW16=0 Output data[15:12] = '0000' Output data[11:0] = read data[9:0] '00' If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[13:0]) '00'
If UNPACK 0 or RAW16=0 Output data[15:12] = '0000' Output data[11:0] = read data[7:0] '0000' If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[11:0]) '0000'
If UNPACK=1 or 2, this value is invalid. If UNPACK=3 or (UNPACK=0 and RAW16=0) Output data[15:0] = '0000' read data[15:4] If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[10:0]) '00000'
If UNPACK 0 or RAW16=0 Output data[15:12] = '0000' Output data[11:0] = read data[8:0] '000' If UNPACK=0 and RAW16=1 Output data[15:0] = (read data[12:0]) '000'

bitfield.description: IPIPEIF IPIPE module pixel clock selection. This register shall be set to '1' when INPSRC1 or INPSRC2 = 1 or 3, i.e., data are solely read from SDRAM (VPORT inactive).

bitenum.description: Selects the pixel clock from the VPORT.
Selects the pixel clock from the fractional clock divider. The fractional clock divider value is setup with the register.

bitfield.description: 8-Bit, 12-bit Packed Mode When sensor raw data are stored in 8-bit packed mode or 12-bit packed mode, this register should code 1 or 3. This register is effective when INPSRC = 1 or 2.

bitenum.description: 16 bits / pixel
8 bits / pixel
12 bits / pixel
8 bits / pixel + inverse A law (8 bits to 10 bits)

bitfield.description: Averaging Filter It applies (1,2,1) filter for the RGB/YCbCr data. *This bit field is latched by VD.
RAW16/12 format of SDRAM This affect how DATASFT works. This bit is valid if UNPCK=0.
Selects the source for the mux (ISIF / SDRAM) as well as the data format type.

bitenum.description: from SDRAM (raw data)
from SDRAM (YUV data)
Dark frame subtration or WDR merge is selected. from ISIF SDRAM (Darkframe Subtraction : DFS, or WDR merge)

bitfield.description: Pixel Decimation The decimation rate defined by RSZ register. *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: No decimation

bitfield.description: One Shot Mode This register is available when INPSRC = 1 or 3.

bitenum.description: Continuous mode
One shot mode

register.description: IPIPEIF Interval of HD / Start pixel in HD

bitfield.description: Case-1: Interval of Horizontal Sync (HD) Specifies the interval of horizontal sync. This register is available when INPSRC = 1 or 3. Case-2: Start Pixel in Horizontal Sync (HD) Specifies the start pixel in horizontal sync. This register is available when INPSRC = 2 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF Interval of VD / Start line in VD

bitfield.description: Case-1: Interval of Vertical Sync (VD) Specifies the interval of vertical sync. This register is available when INPSRC = 1 or 3. Case-2: Start Pixel in Vertical Sync (VD) Specifies the start line in vertical sync. This register is available when INPSRC = 2 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF Number of valid pixels per line

bitfield.description: The Number of Valid Pixels in a Line Specifies the number of valid pixels in a horizontal line. This register is available when INPSRC = 1, 2 or 3 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF Number of valid lines per frame

bitfield.description: The Number of Valid Line in a Vertical Specifies the number of valid line in a vertical. This register is available when INPSRC = 1, 2 or 3 *This bit field is latched by VD.
Memory Address ? Upper Memory address upper 11-bits are specified in units of 32-bytes This register is available when INPSRC = 1, 2 or 3. *This bit field is latched by VD.
Memory Address - Lower Memory address lower 16-bits are specified in units of 32-bytes. This register is available when INPSRC = 1, 2 or 3. *This bit field is latched by VD.

Specifies the SDRAM stride for each line in units of 32-bytes. This register is available when reading data from SDRAM: INPSRC1 or INPSRC2 = 1, 2 or 3. Assuming that the first line is at position ADDR, the second line is at address ADDR+ ADOFS, etc. *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF Horizontal Resizing Parameter on IPIPE datapath

bitfield.description: Horizontal Resizing Parameter for IPIPE datapath Specifies the horizontal resizing parameter. The RSZ register can be configured within 16 to 112 range. This resizing ratio is determined by 16/RSZ (= 1/1 to 1/7) *This bit field is latched by VD.

Gain Parameter Specifies the gain applied to RAW data before it is forwarded to the IPIPE module. The gain value is expressed using the U10Q9 fractional format. The range is from 0.00195 (1/512) to 1.99805(1023/512). By default the unity gain is applied, i.e.,IPIPEIF_GAIN.GAIN = 0x200. The gain is applied to RAW data only (IPIPEIF_CFG1.INPSRC2 != 3): the gain is not applied if the input data is YCbCr. *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF DPCM configuration This register applies only if.UNPACK = 1, i.e., RAW8 data is read from SDRAM. This register access is enabled by the Nokia Custom key

bitfield.description: DPCM bit mode for SDRAM data This register access is enabled by the Nokia Custom key

bitenum.description: 8bit to 10bit DPCM decompression
8bit to 12bit DPCM decompression

bitfield.description: DPCM prediction mode for SDRAM data This register access is enabled by the Nokia Custom key

bitenum.description: Simple predictor
Advanced predictor

bitfield.description: DPCM decompression enable for SDRAM data.

bitenum.description: DPCM off (no decompression)
DPCM on

bitfield.description: 8-bit YUV data unpacking to 16 bits WhenIPIPEIF_CFG1.INPSRC2 = 0 and IPIPEIF_CFG2.YUV16 = 1, the 8-bit YUV data are transformed into 16-bit YUV data. The way the data are unpacked from 8 bits to 16 bits is controlled by the IPIPEIF_CFG2.YUV8P register. The upper 8 bits of the 16-bit output are set to 0.

bitenum.description: Y output on even pixels C output on odd pixels
C output on even pixels Y output on odd pixels

bitfield.description: YUV 8bit mode When ISIF_CFG1.INPSRC2 = 0 and YUV16 = 1, setting this bit to 1 enables the conversion from 8bit YUV input to 16bit YUV. This register is used when the input data from the ISIF module is 8-bit YUV data.

bitenum.description: YUV16 input
YUV 8bit input This value is not allowed if.INPSRC1=1 and .INPSRC2=0

bitfield.description: DFS direction Selects the direction of dark frame subtraction.

bitenum.description: In DFS mode VPORT IF(capture frame) - SDRAM (dark frame) In WDR mode Long Exposure: VPORT, Short Exposure: SDRAM
In DFS mode SDRAM (capture frame) - VPORT IF(dark frame) In WDR mode Long Exposure: SDRAM, Short Exposure: VPORT

bitfield.description: External WEN signal selection Do not use for OMAP4 and MONICA since there is not parallel interface at chip level. This register shall always be set to 0.

bitenum.description: do not use external WEN
use external WEN

bitfield.description: Data type selection. The behavior of this bitfield depends upon other register settings. The functionality is best explained with the following pseudo code: if ((CFG1.INPSRC2==0 CFG2.YUV16) || CFG1.INPSRC2==3) { data_out[15:0] = yuv[15:0] } else if (CFG1.INPSRC2==1 CFG2.YUV16 CFG1.UNPACK=1) { data_out[15:8] = gain_clip[7:0]; data_out[ 7:0] = 0; } else { data_out[15: 0] = gain_clip[15:0]; } where: o data_out[15:0] = 16bit yuv or 16bit raw data to ipipe o yuv[15:0] = 16bit yuv data from 'horizontal pixel decimator' block. o gain_clip[15:0] = 16bit raw data from 'gain' block.

bitenum.description: 12-bit RAW data
16-bit YUV data

bitfield.description: VD Sync Polarity When input VD is active low SYNC pulse, this bit needs to be set to ?1?.
HD Sync Polarity When input HD is active low SYNC pulse, this bit needs to be set to ?1?.
IPIPEIF interrupt source selection. This register select the interrupt source.

bitenum.description: Start position of VD from VPORT interface
Start position of VD from ISIF module

register.description: IPIPEIF resize initial position - IPIPE data path. This value is not used in the c-model, as C-model expects the first pixel postion is the same as the first input pixel. To match HW with C-model, INIRSZ must be equal to the cycles between HD and the first cycle. In FDS/WDR mode, INIRSZ=PPLN

bitfield.description: Align the HSYNC,VSYNC to initial position defined by INIRSZ.
Offset used to re-initialize the HD/VD position after resizer. From 0 to 8191 PCLK cycles.
Output clipping value after gain control on IPIPE data path. This value is in U16Q0 data format. For nomarl mode, this value should be 0 OCLIP 4096 For WDR mode, this value should be 0 OCLIP 65536

To guarantee that the FIFO does not overflow, the stall request is deasserted only when a certain number of locations in the FIFO are free. The number of free locations is configurable. A safe number of mandatory free locations can be configured by taking into consideration the pixel clock frequency (PCLK) with respect to that of the functional clock (FUNC CLK). The worst case occurs when PCLK = FUNC CLK. In that case, value should be configured to 0 (i.e. 16 free locations) so that the stall will be deasserted only when the 16-deep FIFO is completely empty.

bitenum.description: Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 13 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 1 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 7 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 6 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO is empty (16 free locations) and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 5 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 10 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 9 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 11 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 4 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 2 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 15 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 12 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 3 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 8 valid entry and SDRAM data available
Stall deassertion when FIFO has not more than 14 valid entry and SDRAM data available

bitfield.description: Enable memory-to-memory stall mechanism

bitenum.description: disable (no special stall mechanism for memory-to-memory use cases)
enable (stall mechanism for memory-to-memory use cases)

bitfield.description: Data under flow error status register. Reading ?1? shows there is data under flow and at least one data is corrupted while reading from SDRAM. Writing ?1? to this register clears (=0) the error (=1) status. Underflow errors are non recoverable at ISP5 level, need to do a soft reset at ISS level. The IPIPEIF_UDF interrupt is generated when an underflow happens. The interrupt avoids polling this register for errors. If ENM2MSTALL is enabled, then programmers need to ensure that the SW does not clear DTUDF[0] as this would reset the MTC read interface. DTUDF[0] can be cleared only in the on-the-fly operation where the stall mechanism will not work.

IPIPEIF clock rate configuration IPIPE/IPIPEIF clock frequency = M/N x clk_vpss clock frequency. We have M = CLKDIV[15:8] + 1 and N = CLKDIV[7:0] + 1 This register is available whenIPIPEIF_CFG1.CLKSEL = 1.
DPC enable. Applies DPC for video port data, ISIF input path.
DPC threshold value
DPC enable. Applies DPC for SDRAM input path.
DPC threshold value

register.description: IPIPEIF DARK FRAME GAIN CONTROL - GAIN VALUE

bitfield.description: DFS gain control enable. This functionality is protected by an eFuse. Not available when ISP5_EFUSE4_EN = '0'.
DFS gain value. This functionality is protected by an eFuse. Not available when ISP5_EFUSE4_EN = '0'.

register.description: IPIPEIF DARK FRAME GAIN CONTROL - THRESHOLD VALUE

bitfield.description: DFS gain threshold value. This functionality is protected by an eFuse. Not available when ISP5_EFUSE4_EN = '0'.

register.description: IPIPEIF HORIZONTAL RESIZING PARAMETER FOR H3A

bitfield.description: Pixel Decimation Enable The decimation rate defined by the RSZ bitfield. *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: No Decimation

bitfield.description: Averaging Filter It applies a (1, 2, 1) filter for the RGB/YCbCr data. *This bit field is latched by VD.

Horizontal Resizing Parameter for H3A datapath Specifies the horizontal resizing parameter. The RSZ register can be configured within 16 to 112 range. This resizing ratio is determined by 16/RSZ (= 1/1 to 1/7) *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF resize initial position - H3A data path.

bitfield.description: Align the HD, VD to initial position defined by the INIRSZ bit field. It means that HD and VD are effectivly shifted by INIRSZ pixel clock cycles.
Offset used to re-initialize the HD/VD position after resizer. From 0 to 8191 PCLK cycles.

Issue C_DONE at the end of frame. If this function is on, C_DONE is issued at the end of frame even if the last line not N-th line in ICM handshake sequence. If the last line is N-th line, C_DONE is issued regardless of this bit. *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Disable C_DONE at the end of frame, unless it is the Nth line of ICM handshake proess.
Enalble output of C_DONE at the enf of frame.

bitfield.description: Handshake with ICM is enabled Note: If ICM handshake is on in DFS/WDR mode (INPSRC1=2 or INPSRC2=2), memory-to-memory stall mechanism must be on (IPIPEIF_DTUDF.ENM2MSTALL=1) *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Handshake with ICM is disabled
Handshake with ICM is enabled

bitfield.description: ICM Handshake cycle U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.
Enable circular buffering *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Circular buffering disabled
Circular buffer enabled

bitfield.description: Circular buffer cycle U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: IPIPEIF WDR configuration for WDR merging

bitfield.description: Down shift value after WDR merge *This bit field is latched by VD.
Shift up value for short exposure pixel Usually set (16- (bit width of long exposure pixels)). For example, if the input is 12 bit, set 4 here. *This bit field is latched by VD.
Shift up value for long exposure pixel Usually set (16- (bit width of long exposure pixels)). For example, if the input is 12 bit, set 4 here. *This bit field is latched by VD.
Select the source for weight calculation in WDR merge *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Use long_exposure pixel for weight calculation
Use short exposure value for weight calculation.

bitfield.description: Enable WDR merge (Two frame/single frame) When this function is enabled, WDR is used instead of DFS. *This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: DISABLE WDR merging function.
ENABLE WDR function. WDR overtake DFS function.

bitfield.description: WDR Merge parameter AFE Exponential part of a value in weight calculation Unsigned 5bit *This bit field is latched by VD.
WDR Merge parameter AF_M Coefficient (mantissa) part of a value in weight calculation Signed 16bit *This bit field is latched by VD.
WDR Merge parameter BF Q0.15) The actual value is BF x 2^-16 x 2^-5 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Gain difference between long exposure and short exposure

bitfield.description: The gain applied to short exposure pixels. (U1.15) Usually, this value is 32768 *This bit field is latched by VD. For example, if the gain difference is x4, GDIFF = 8192

The gain applied to long exposure pixels. (U1.15) Usually, this value is GLONG = 32768 * (short exposure gain in camera)/(long exposure gain in camera) *This bit field is latched by VD. For example, if the gain difference is x4, GDIFF = 8192
T (Threshold value) U16 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: White Balance used in weight calculation
Black level for Long exposure input

bitfield.description: Black level for long exposure pixel at [0, 1] (Odd pixel at even line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.
Black level for long exposure pixel at [0, 0] (Even pixel at even line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Black level for Long exposure input

bitfield.description: Black level for long exposure pixel at [1, 1] (Odd pixel at odd line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.
1lack level for long exposure pixel at [1, 0 ] (Even pixel at odd line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Black level for short exposure input

bitfield.description: Black level for short exposure pixel at [0, 1] (Odd pixel at even line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.
Black level for short exposure pixel at [0, 0] (Even pixel at even line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Black level for short exposure input

bitfield.description: Black level for short exposure pixel at [1, 1] (Odd pixel at odd line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.
1lack level for short exposure pixel at [1, 0 ] (Even pixel at odd line) U12 *This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Threshold value in motion adaptive filter

bitfield.description: Slope in motion adaptive filter MAS = 32768/(D2-D1) U16 *This bit field is latched by VD.
Threshold (D1) in motion adaptive filter U16 To disable MA filtering, put the maximum value (65535: default) *This bit field is latched by VD.
Saturation value for VPORT input used in WDR split function for pseudo-long-exposure image Do disable, set maximum value (1048575: default) *This bit field is latched by VD.
DC Clamp addition value for VPORT input (Used in WDR split function for pseudo-short-exposure) *This bit field is latched by VD.
Down shift value for VPORT input (Used in WDR split function for pseudo-short-exposure) *This bit field is latched by VD.
Enable saturation function on VPort *This bit field is latched by VD.

Saturation/Down shift on VPORT input is enabled

bitfield.description: Saturation value for ISIF input used in WDR split function for pseudo-long-exposure image Do disable, set maximum value (1048575: default) *This bit field is latched by VD.
